column4: does anyone have any knowledge on why Firefox 3 would randomly erase all of my settings, bookmarks, saved passwords, etc., unprovoked?
sounds like you got yourself a profile problem and firefox created a new one for you
run firefox from a terminal.. try "firefox --help".. there is a switch to start with a profile selector.. something like firefox --profilemanager

alright, I'll check out the profiles real fast. I literally got up from my computer, left it for an hour, came back, and all my settings were erase.d and I know that no one used my computer while I was up.
I don't think they are erased.. they are just not being used (if I'm correct)

I ran "firefox -profilemanager" like the help file referred to, but nothing regarding profiles came up. just an about:blank screen as I've been experiencing when I would open Firefox normally, without the -profilemanager tag.
check permissions using ls -l ...  I'm guessing you need both read and write permissions or firefox might get upset
when you started firefox using the profile manager you didn't get a small dialog window for selecting which profile to use?
no, I didn't. it just came up as a blank window.
no toolbars, no firefox toolbar bookmarks, no homepage, absolutely nothing. just a blank white screen.
try shutting down all running instances of firefox first
and when I press the Home button, despite my Edit --> Preferences setting to google, it goes to mozilla.org.
run a "pkill firefox" just to be sure
Okay, Firefox is killed, let me try the profilemanager again.
got the window. the only profile listed is default, which is the only one I created.
hmm.. there goes that theory..
I started it with the default profile, and still nothing. same as before.
then I don't really know what to try... sorry
Okay, well thank you for your help. At least I know I tried the common solution.
if I figure out why my Firefox is being wiped, would you like me to report it back to you?
I'm off to bed in a minute or so.. but thanks anyway
oh alrighty. well thank you again. =)
